body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
The `readyz` and `livez` urls do not provide as much information about the cluster as much as `healthz` does. It's expected to see `etcd` and `kms-provider-#`(if kms is enabled) but does not. 
**What you expected to happen**:
`readyz` and `livez` url to include `etcd` and `kms-provider-#`
**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

1. Create any 1.16 pre-release cluster
1. Curl the server url for `/healthz?verbose`, `/readyz?verbose` and `/livez?verbose`

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.2", GitCommit:"f6278300bebbb750328ac16ee6dd3aa7d3549568", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-05T09:23:26Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"16+", GitVersion:"v1.16.0-rc.1+IKS", GitCommit:"2537334a1f80f21d1e5455885e77c0abf25468a5", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-09-11T12:53:42Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: IBM
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): 
```
# cat /etc/os-release
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="18.04.3 LTS (Bionic Beaver)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS"
VERSION_ID="18.04"
HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
VERSION_CODENAME=bionic
UBUNTU_CODENAME=bionic
```
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 
```
Linux dev-bltub3q00j6tsvvjs51g-v116beta2-default-00000228 4.15.0-60-generic #67-Ubuntu SMP Thu Aug 22 16:55:30 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

Logs:
healthz
```
$ curl -k $(kubectl config view | grep "server:" | head -1 | awk '{ print $2 }')/healthz?verbose
[+]ping ok
[+]log ok
[+]etcd ok
[+]kms-provider-0 ok
[+]kms-provider-1 ok
[+]poststarthook/generic-apiserver-start-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-controllers ok
[+]poststarthook/crd-informer-synced ok
[+]poststarthook/bootstrap-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/rbac/bootstrap-roles ok
[+]poststarthook/scheduling/bootstrap-system-priority-classes ok
[+]poststarthook/ca-registration ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-apiserver-admission-initializer ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-aggregator-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-registration-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-status-available-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/kube-apiserver-autoregistration ok
[+]autoregister-completion ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-openapi-controller ok
healthz check passed
```
readyz
```
$ curl -k $(kubectl config view | grep "server:" | head -1 | awk '{ print $2 }')/readyz?verbose
[+]ping ok
[+]log ok
[+]poststarthook/generic-apiserver-start-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-controllers ok
[+]poststarthook/crd-informer-synced ok
[+]poststarthook/bootstrap-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/rbac/bootstrap-roles ok
[+]poststarthook/scheduling/bootstrap-system-priority-classes ok
[+]poststarthook/ca-registration ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-apiserver-admission-initializer ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-aggregator-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-registration-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-status-available-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/kube-apiserver-autoregistration ok
[+]autoregister-completion ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-openapi-controller ok
[+]shutdown ok
healthz check passed
```
livez
```
$ curl -k $(kubectl config view | grep "server:" | head -1 | awk '{ print $2 }')/livez?verbose
[+]ping ok
[+]log ok
[+]poststarthook/generic-apiserver-start-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-controllers ok
[+]poststarthook/crd-informer-synced ok
[+]poststarthook/bootstrap-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/rbac/bootstrap-roles ok
[+]poststarthook/scheduling/bootstrap-system-priority-classes ok
[+]poststarthook/ca-registration ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-apiserver-admission-initializer ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-aggregator-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-registration-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-status-available-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/kube-apiserver-autoregistration ok
[+]autoregister-completion ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-openapi-controller ok
healthz check passed
```
/sig api-machinery

title: Readyz and livez do not match healthz
